answers.answer: Hello,These vibrations can be due to parasthesia that are common in alcoholics and metabolic disorders like diabetes, hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidism. They can also be due to peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the symptoms are gone or not.In case the symptoms persist then consult a neurologist as it can be due to some neurological disorder.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I had a tingling in my heel and I felt  just a little twitching in my leg and thigh. Then it felt warm in the lower part of leg, not warm to touch, but a warm sensation. For a moment my leg  felt a little heavy.  What could ths be?
title: womens health
